title: So should I hold my nose and buy NHF now?
text:
Well at some point soon there is supposed to be an update from TX Courts on whether their Forever War vs Credit Suisse will continue, be resolved, or continue to appealed further, with ever diminishing odds. The advisor has been chary of providing anything beyond the most bare updates, buried in footnotes, and expecting investors to be familiar with PACER, BLAW and all that. Years ago they would provide some updates, especially since shareholders were funding an expensive endeavour.

There was a 1000 day period of time when Highland could do no wrong. It seemed like everything they touched worked out well -- AA BK, Freedom REIT, CLO spread tightening, lawsuits, etc. And then for the last 1000+ days its been almost the polar opposite.

Remember that discount doesn't mean much here. NAV or mgmt's estimate of value isn't a traditional est like other funds. Too much here is private assets or super illiquid.
description: Almost a 17% discount. but can they manage their way thru.... anything? I know some here are somewhat reluctant owners of this.. perhaps even dare I - 20431
